verses.text_plain: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually.
verses.verse_html:
1Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually. ▼
▼ Maschil: or, of instruction

tokens.definition: הָלַל hâlal, haw-lal'; a primitive root; to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make a show, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify:—(make) boast (self), celebrate, commend, (deal, make), fool(-ish, -ly), glory, give (light), be (make, feign self) mad (against), give in marriage, (sing, be worthy of) praise, rage, renowned, shine.

verses.text_plain: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

tokens.definition: חָשַׁב châshab, khaw-shab'; a primitive root; properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute:—(make) account (of), conceive, consider, count, cunning (man, work, workman), devise, esteem, find out, forecast, hold, imagine, impute, invent, be like, mean, purpose, reckon(-ing be made), regard, think.

tokens.definition: עוֹלָם ʻôwlâm, o-lawm'; or עֹלָם ʻôlâm; from H5956 ; properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always:—alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world ( + without end). Compare H5331 , H5703 .
tokens.kjv_translation_count: ever (272x), everlasting (63x), old (22x), perpetual (22x), evermore (15x), never (13x), time (6x), ancient (5x), world (4x), always (3x), alway (2x), long (2x), more (2x), never (with H 408) (2x), miscellaneous (6x).
outline: long duration, antiquity, futurity, for ever, ever, everlasting, evermore, perpetual, old, ancient, world ancient time, long time (of past) (of future) for ever, always continuous existence, perpetual everlasting, indefinite or unending future, eternity
(of future) for ever, always continuous existence, perpetual everlasting, indefinite or unending future, eternity
everlasting, indefinite or unending future, eternity

tokens.definition: עָשָׂה ʻâsâh, aw-saw'; a primitive root; to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application:—accomplish, advance, appoint, apt, be at, become, bear, bestow, bring forth, bruise, be busy, × certainly, have the charge of, commit, deal (with), deck, displease, do, (ready) dress(-ed), (put in) execute(-ion), exercise, fashion, feast, (fight-) ing man, finish, fit, fly, follow, fulfill, furnish, gather, get, go about, govern, grant, great, hinder, hold (a feast), × indeed, be industrious, journey, keep, labour, maintain, make, be meet, observe, be occupied, offer, officer, pare, bring (come) to pass, perform, pracise, prepare, procure, provide, put, requite, × sacrifice, serve, set, shew, × sin, spend, × surely, take, × thoroughly, trim, × very, vex, be (warr-) ior, work(-man), yield, use.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: do (1,: 333x), make (653x), wrought (52x), deal (52x), commit (49x), offer (49x), execute (48x), keep (48x), shew (43x), prepare (37x), work (29x), do so (21x), perform (18x), get (14x), dress (13x), maker (13x), maintain (7x), miscellaneous (154x).

tokens.definition: קָוָה qâvâh, kaw-vaw'; a primitive root; to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect:—gather (together), look, patiently, tarry, wait (for, on, upon).
tokens.kjv_translation_count: wait (29x), look (13x), wait for (1x), look for (1x), gathered (1x), miscellaneous (4x).
outline: to wait, look for, hope, expect (Qal) waiting (participle) (Piel) to wait or look eagerly for to lie in wait for to wait for, linger for

to wait or look eagerly for
to collect, bind together (Niphal) to be collected

tokens.definition: שֵׁם shêm, shame; a primitive word [perhaps rather from H7760 through the idea of definite and conspicuous position; compare H8064 ]; an appellation, as a mark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character:— + base, (in-) fame(-ous), named(-d), renown, report.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: name (832x), renown (7x), fame (4x), famous (3x), named (3x), named (with H 7121) (2x), famous (with H 7121) (1x), infamous (with H 2931) (1x), report (1x), miscellaneous (10x).
outline: name name reputation, fame, glory the Name (as designation of God) memorial, monument

tokens.definition: טוֹב ṭôwb, tobe; from H2895 ; good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well):—beautiful, best, better, bountiful, cheerful, at ease, × fair (word), (be in) favour, fine, glad, good (deed, -lier, -liest, -ly, -ness, -s), graciously, joyful, kindly, kindness, liketh (best), loving, merry, × most, pleasant, pleaseth, pleasure, precious, prosperity, ready, sweet, wealth, welfare, (be) well(-favoured).

tokens.definition: חָסִיד châçîyd, khaw-seed'; from H2616 ; properly, kind, i.e. (religiously) pious (a saint):—godly (man), good, holy (one), merciful, saint, (un-) godly.
